subject: AI & Agents
title: Designing for Uncertainty: AI Isn't Perfect
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Designing for Uncertainty: AI Isn't Perfect.

hook.text: Your AI feature is 90% accurate. That means 1 in 10 users sees a wrong answer.

buildup.text: Unlike traditional software, AI outputs are probabilisticâ€”sometimes wrong, sometimes great.

discovery.text: Design patterns: confidence indicators, edit buttons, fallback options, and human escalation.

twist.text: Users forgive errors if they can easily correct them. They rage-quit if they can't.

climax.text: Make AI suggestions, not AI decisions. Let users confirm, edit, or reject.

punchline.text: Design for the 10% that's wrong, not the 90% that's right.

quiz.question: How should AI features handle uncertainty?
options: Offer suggestions with edit and reject options
